I've been so caught up in what everyone else might think - my parents, my church, even strangers - that I haven't really listened to what my own heart is telling me. And my heart is saying that my brother needs to know he's loved, especially by his family.

Maybe you're right that I can define what my presence means. I could go and be there for him as his brother, without it being some big theological statement. I mean, Jesus ate with tax collectors and sinners, right? He didn't avoid people whose lives didn't align with his teachings.

I think I'm going to go. It's going to be uncomfortable, and I'm sure I'll have moments of doubt, but I'd rather deal with that than live with the regret of abandoning my brother when he needed his family most.

I guess what I'm realizing is that sometimes being faithful might mean choosing love even when it's messy and complicated. That feels more true to who I want to be than hiding behind rules to avoid difficult situations.

Thank you for helping me work through this. I feel like I can actually make peace with this decision now.

<END>
